      • rollingHash

        public static long rollingHash(char[] str,
                               int oldIndex,
                               int newIndex,
                               long oldHash,
                               int pLen)
        Parameters:
        str - text string
        oldIndex - first index of old string
        newIndex - next index which will be added to rolling hash
        oldHash - previous hash code
        pLen - pattern length
        Returns:
        new hash code just consider this, if the pattern len =3, and patter is cde, where code for correspondng chara c=2, d=3, e=4 so, the then hash= 2*BASE^0+3*BASE^1+4*BASE^2 now if we are here with old has as above hash, and we will remove the first one and will add next char Lets say, next char is f=5, so, newHash= hash- {value of c which is 2} as BASE^0 is 1 So, now the remaining oldHash = 3*BASE^1+4*BASE^2 we can divide them as newHash=newHash/BASE= 3*BASE^0+4*BASE^1 Now, we will add new char f, which will add 4*BASE^2 as len =3,
